news_header: Georgian transgender woman Kesaria Abramidze, 37, was murdered a day after the parliament passed an anti-LGBT law, raising concerns about hate crimes and discrimination.
news_text: Kesaria Abramidze, a prominent transgender woman in Georgia, was stabbed to death in her home in Tbilisi, just one day after the parliament approved a controversial anti-LGBT bill. The legislation, which restricts rights for LGBT individuals, has been linked to an increase in hate crimes, with activists arguing that the government's rhetoric has fueled transphobia. President Salome Zurabishvili condemned the murder, highlighting urgent questions about discrimination and hate crimes. The law has drawn criticism from both local and international rights groups, with comparisons made to restrictive Russian laws.
